climaApp.name: ClimaApp
climaApp.description:
In this project, my main role was to search for APIs and figure out how to use them since we were working in a group.

I started by getting familiar with async functions, which felt a bit odd at first. But once I began making requests, everything started to click.

I also had to brush up on working with JSONs. Looking back, I feel like I couldâ€™ve contributed more to the front end, and I'm eager to improve on that in future projects.
climaApp.learned: In this project, I really leveled up my understanding of async functions and how to use APIs. Plus, since it was one of my first team projects, I had to learn how to work well with others, which was a great experience!

calculadora.name: Calculadora
calculadora.description:
Since it was my first time diving into web development, I started figuring out how to use the technologies I needed.

Getting into HTML and CSS, I found structuring and styling the calculator to be the trickiest part. CSS can be a bit less intuitive than it looks, but I did my best to stick to the design.

The fun part was working on the logic; I aimed to keep the code clean and functional. There are definitely some features I think I could improve.
calculadora.learned: Once I wrapped up my project, I got a much better grasp of CSS attributes and picked up some new JavaScript techniques. Personally, I think learning how to use Arrow Functions was my biggest win in this project!
